summary: In this context, 1,4-dichlorobenzene and 4-xylene are both mentioned as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) detected in air samples, but there is no direct discussion of their relationship or interaction. They are part of a broader analysis comparing indoor and outdoor air quality, with 4-xylene being one of the frequently detected compounds alongside others like toluene and benzene. However, their specific roles or interactions are not elaborated upon.
